info.title: Sage Accounting API - Settings
info.description: Documentation of the Sage Business Cloud Accounting API.

contact.name: Sage Business Cloud Accounting API Team

tags.name: Business Activity Types
tags.description: This endpoint is restricted to French businesses specifically and gives information about the commercial nature of the business (e.g. Ã‰levage de vaches laitiÃ¨res - Dairy Farming). The business' actual business activity type is dictated by the business settings endpoint where it can be updated. The API allows show and index.

tags.name: Business Settings
tags.description:
This endpoint defines numerous global and region specific business level settings in addition to all default ledger_accounts. The API allows show and update requests for this endpoint.

Related Guide: Key Concepts: Settings

tags.name: Business Types
tags.description: This endpoint is used to read the region specific business types that are available for the associated business (e.g. For UKI businesses SOLE, PARTNER, LIMITED). The business type is dictated by the business settings endpoint where it can be updated. The API allows show and index requests for this endpoint.

tags.name: Cis Settings
tags.description: This endpoint defines Construction Industry Scheme (CIS) settings for UK only businesses. For example, the ability to specify a business as a contractor or subcontractor. The API allows initial create as well as update and show requests for these settings.

tags.name: Datev Settings
tags.description: German businesses who use Sage Business Cloud Accounting are able to export their audit trail in the DATEV format. This endpoint allows users to manage the accompanying settings for the DATEV export. The API allows both show and update requests.

tags.name: Financial Settings
tags.description: This endpoint defines a number of global and region specific financial based settings. For example regional tax settings such as tax number. The API allows both show and update requests.

tags.name: Invoice Settings
tags.description: Although the endpoint is named "Invoice Settings" all types of sales transactional settings are managed here in addition to all invoice related settings, including: invoices, quotes, estimates, credit notes etc. The API allows both index and update requests.

tags.name: Legal Form Types
tags.description: This endpoint is restricted to French businesses and returns all legal form types. The business' actual legal form type is dictated by the business settings endpoint where it can be updated. The API allows show and index.

tags.name: Country Of Registrations
tags.description: Every limited business in the UK and Ireland must have a country of registration (E.g. ENGLAND AND WALES). The country of registration is dictated by the business settings endpoint where it can be updated. This endpoint returns a list of the availale countries that are accepted in business settings. The API allows only SHOW and INDEX actions.

parameters.name: updated_or_created_since
parameters.description: Use this to limit the response to Analysis Type Categories changed since a given date (format: YYYY-MM-DDT(+|-)hh:mm) or date-time (format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss(+|-)hh:mm). Inclusive of the passed timestamp.

parameters.name: analysis_type_level
parameters.description: Use this to filter Analysis Type Categories by analysis_type_level

parameters.name: items_per_page
parameters.description: Returns the given number of Analysis Type Categories per request.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Go to specific page of Analysis Type Categories

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Specify the attributes that you want to expose for the Analysis Type Categories (expose all attributes with 'all'). These are in addition to the base attributes (name, path)

unique_tax_reference.description: Unique Tax Reference, format should match ########## (10 digits) e.g. 1234567890

accounts_office_reference.description: Accounts Office Reference, format should match ###PX???????? e.g. 123PA1234567A or 123PA12345678

paye_reference.description: PAYE Reference, format should match ###/X?##### e.g. 123/A45678 or 123/AB45678

year_end_date.description: The financial year end date of the business

year_end_lockdown_date.description: The year end lockdown date of the business

accounting_type.description: Indicates the accounting type of a business, it can be accrual or cash based

accounts_start_date.description: The accounts start date of the business

base_currency.description: The base currency of the business

multi_currency_enabled.description: Indicates whether multi-currency is enabled for the business

use_live_exchange_rates.description: Indicates whether to use live or business defined exchange rates

mtd_activation_status.description: Indicates the UK Making Tax Digital for VAT activation status

mtd_connected.description: Indicates whether UK Making Tax Digital for VAT is currently connected

mtd_authenticated_date.description: Indicates when a UK business enabled UK Making Tax Digital for VAT, nil if not enabled or non-uk

tax_scheme.description: The tax scheme of the business

general_tax_number.description: The number for various tax report submissions

flat_rate_tax_percentage.description: The tax percentage that applies to flat rate tax schemes.

recoverable_percentage.description: The partial recoverable tax rate (Canada only)

sales_tax_calculation.description: The method of collection for tax on sales. Allowed values - "invoice", "cash".

purchase_tax_calculation.description: The method of collection for tax on purchases. Allowed values - "invoice", "cash".

destination_vat.description: Indicates whether to use destination vat or not

postponed_accounting.description: Indicates whether to use postponed accounting or not

destination_vat.description: Indicates whether to use destination vat or not

separate_invoice_credit_note_numbering.description: Indicates whether to use separate or combined number sequences for invoices and credit notes

sales_invoice_number_prefix.description: The prefix to use for sales invoices

sales_credit_note_number_prefix.description: The prefix to use for sales credit notes

invoice_terms_and_conditions.description: The default terms and conditions to include on invoices

default_note_on_invoice.description: The default notes to include on invoices

default_note_on_credit_note.description: The default notes to include on credit notes

default_note_on_estimate.description: The default notes to include on estimates

default_note_on_quote.description: The default notes to include on quotes

quote_number_prefix.description: The prefix to use for sales quotes

estimate_number_prefix.description: The prefix to use for sales estimates

quote_default_days_to_expiry.description: The default number of days before quotes expire

estimate_default_days_to_expiry.description: The default number of days before estimates expire

quote_terms_and_conditions.description: The default terms and conditions to include on quotes

estimate_terms_and_conditions.description: The default terms and conditions to include on estimates

delivery_note_terms_and_conditions.description: The default terms and conditions to include on delivery notes

delivery_note_show_signature.description: Indicates whether to include the signature lines on delivery notes

delivery_note_show_picked.description: Indicates whether to include the picked column on delivery notes

delivery_note_show_notes.description: Indicates whether to include the document notes on delivery notes

delivery_note_show_contact_details.description: Indicates whether to include contact details on delivery notes

quick_entry_prefix.description: The prefix to use for quick entries

late_payment_percentage.description: The percentage charge applied to late payment of invoices (France only)

prompt_payment_percentage.description: The percentage applied to late payment of invoices (France only)

show_auto_entrepreneur.description: Indicates whether to include auto entrepreneur details on invoices (France only)

show_insurance.description: Indicates whether to include insurance details on invoices (France only)

insurer.description: The insurer of the business (France only)

insurance_area.description: The insurance area to be displayed on invoices (France only)

insurance_type.description: The insurance type to be displayed on invoices (France only)

insurance_text.description: The insurance mention to be displayed on invoices (France only)

sales_corrective_invoice_number_prefix.description: The sales corrective invoice number prefix (Spain only)

next_sales_corrective_invoice_number.description: The next sales corrective invoice number

document_headings.description: The customisable document headings used on printed documents

line_item_titles.description: The customisable line item column headings

customer_credit_days.description:
The default delay within which the business' customer has to pay an invoice
Prefer the (customer) contact's attribute 'credit_days' over this setting
to calculate an invoice's date of payment; only if null, use this as default.

customer_credit_terms.description:
The default credit terms options determine how invoice due dates are calculated.
Options include: end of next month, a delay of customer credit_days and immediately.
Only: month_end_invoice, date_from_invoice, immediate_invoice are valid values.
Prefer the (customer) contact's credit terms over this setting
to calculate an invoice's date of payment; only if null, use this as default.

vendor_credit_terms.description:
The default credit terms options determine how invoice due dates are calculated.
Options include: end of next month, a delay of supplier credit_days and immediately.
Only: month_end_payment, date_from_payment, immediate_payment are valid values.
Prefer the (vendor) contact's credit terms over this setting
to calculate an invoice's date of payment; only if null, use this as default.

updated_at.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

$path.description: The API path for the resource

created_at.description: The datetime when the item was created

updated_at.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

deleted_at.description: The datetime when the item was deleted

contact_types.description: The type of the contact. It has to be either CUSTOMER or VENDOR

name.description: The contact's full name or business name

default_sales_ledger_account.description:
The default sales ledger account for the contact
Customers only

default_sales_tax_rate.description:
The default sales tax rate for the contact
Customers only

default_purchase_ledger_account.description:
The default purchase ledger account for the contact
Vendors only

tax_number.description: The VAT registration number of the contact. The format will be validated.

main_address.description: The main address associated with the contact

main_contact_person.description: The main contact person of the contact.

bank_account_details.description: The account details for the contact's bank account

credit_limit.description:
Custom credit limit amount for the contact
not applicable to Start

credit_days.description:
Custom credit days for the contact.
If returned as null in a GET response, you may want to GET /invoice_settings and use 'customer_credit_days'/'vendor_credit_days' as default/fallback according to your use case.

credit_terms.description:
Credit terms options determine how invoice due dates are calculated.
Options include: end of next month, a delay of supplier credit_days and immediately.
Only: month_end_invoice, date_from_invoice, immediate_invoice, month_end_payment,
date_from_payment, immediate_payment are valid values.
If returned as null in a GET response, you may want to GET /invoice_settings
and use 'customer_credit_terms'/'vendor_credit_terms' as default.

credit_terms_and_conditions.description:
Custom terms and conditions for the contact. If set will override global /invoice_settings default terms and conditions.
Customers only

product_sales_price_type.description:
All default product_sales_price_type defaults. Learn more about sales price types
Customers only, not applicable to Start

source_guid.description: Used when importing contacts from external sources

currency.description:
The currency that the contact trades in
not applicable to Start

aux_reference.description:
Auxiliary reference. Used for German "Kreditorennummer" and "Debitorennummer".
See Datev Settings endpoint reference

registered_number.description: The registered number of the contact's business. Only used for German businesses and represents the "Steuernummer" there (not the "USt-ID").

deletable.description: Indicates whether the contact can be deleted successfully

tax_treatment.description: The tax treatment - indicates which tax rules to apply for a contact

email.description: The email address for the given contact

tax_calculation.description:
France: The tax calculation method used to define tax treatment Vendors only
Spain: Defines if contact is a retailer and tax is subject to Recargo de Equivalencia Customers only United Kingdom: Defines if contact tax treatment is domestic reverse charge Customers & Suppliers

auxiliary_account.description:
Auxiliary account - used when auxiliary accounting is enabled in business settings.
Available only in Spain and France

gdpr_obfuscated.description: General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) came into effect on 25th May 2018. It introduces new rules for how business owners manage their contacts' personal data. When this field returns 'true', means that the contact has been requested to be obfuscated and you can not create any artifact (sales invoices, purchase invoices, ...) but you can still check previously created artifacts.

system.description: Identifies a contact as being a system contact used for processing specific transaction types and reserved specifically for those transaction types such as tax return payments/refunds.

has_unfinished_recurring_invoices.description: Indicates whether the contact is associated with any unfinished recurring invoices

cis_registered.description:
Identifies a contact as being registered as CIS.
only applicable to UK business

ni_based.description: Identifies a contact as being based in Northern Ireland.

is_active.description: Identifies a contact as being active

gb_based.description: Identifies a contact as being based in Great Britain.

cis_settings.description: The CIS Settings for the contact

destination_vat_blocking.description: Identifies a contact should be blocked due to destination vat

rel.description: The relationship of the link to the resource

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

$path.description: The API path for the resource

created_at.description: The datetime when the item was created

updated_at.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

ledger_account_group.description: The ledger account group for the account

name.description:
The name for the ledger account.

Changes to this field do not propagate to other resources, namely not to the name of the associated
bank_account (unlike the behaviour of the UI).

display_name.description: The display name for the ledger account

visible_scopes.description:
The visible scopes for the ledger account.

This indicates in which of the UI's areas the ledger account is displayed and available for user
selection. Possible entries in this array are `bank`, `sales`, `purchasing`, `other_payment`,
`other_receipt`, `reporting`, `journals`, `sales_eu`, `sales_row`, `purchasing_eu`, `purchasing_row`
and `purchasing_hrc`.

included_in_chart.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is included in the chart of accounts

nominal_code.description: The nominal code of the ledger account

ledger_account_type.description: The ledger account type for the ledger account

ledger_account_classification.description: The ledger account classification for the ledger account

tax_rate.description: The default tax rate for the ledger account

fixed_tax_rate.description: Indicates whether the default tax rate is fixed or may be changed per transaction

visible_in_banking.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the banking area of the application

visible_in_expenses.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the purchases area of the application

visible_in_journals.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the journals area of the application

visible_in_other_payments.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the other payments area of the application

visible_in_other_receipts.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the other receipts area of the application

visible_in_reporting.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the reporting area of the application

visible_in_sales.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the sales area of the application

balance_details.description: The ledger account balance details for the date range provided

is_control_account.description:
Indicates whether the ledger account is a control account.

Control accounts cannot be removed. See also `control_name`.

control_name.description:
The control name for the ledger account.

This is used internally by Accounting to identify the correct ledger account for booking taxes etc.
You cannot add ledger accounts with control name and you cannot modify the control name of existing
ledger accounts.

display_formatted.description: The display name formatted based on coa_list_order in settings

tax_recoverable.description: Indicates that transactions posted to this ledger account have part recoverable taxes (Canada only)

recoverable_percentage.description: The partial recoverable tax rate (Canada only)

cis_materials.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is flagged for CIS Materials

tax_instalment.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is flagged for Tax Intalment (Canada only)

cis_labour.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is flagged for CIS Labour

gifi_code.description:
The GIFI code of the ledger account.

GIFI is short for The General Index of Financial Information and it lets the CRA validate tax information electronically instead of manually.
Information from financial statements is categorized under the appropriate 4-digit-long GIFI code and entered on corporate income tax returns.
GIFI is needed when filing a T2 income tax return.

_Canada only_

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

credit_or_debit.description: Is the balance a debit or credit

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

$path.description: The API path for the resource

address_line_1.description: The first line of the address

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address

deleted_at.description: The datetime when the item was deleted

created_at.description: The datetime when the item was created

updated_at.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

bank_account.description: The related bank account of the address, if the address belongs to a bank account.

contact.description: The related contact of the address, if the address belongs to a contact.

address_type.description:
Defines the nature of the address (Shipping, Billing, Head Office etc.).
Start defaults to "Sales" for Customers and "Purchasing" for Vendors

name.description: The custom name of the address

country_group.description:
Country group allows countries to be filtered for selection.
Set it to e.g. EU if the address is within the EEC.

is_main_address.description: Specifies the address as the contact's main address. Only a single address can exist for a contact in Start so this is always true when returned by the API but cannot be seen in the UI

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

$path.description: The API path for the resource

created_at.description: The datetime when the item was created

updated_at.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

deleted_at.description: The datetime when the item was deleted

contact_person_types.description: The contact person types for the contact person. Get possible types by retrieving all available contact person types .

name.description: The name of the contact person

job_title.description: The job title of the contact person

telephone.description: The telephone number of the contact person

mobile.description: The mobile number of the contact person

email.description: The email address of the contact person

fax.description: The fax number of the contact person

is_main_contact.description: Indicates whether this is the main contact person. Per contact, only one main contact can be selected.

address.description: The address of the contact person

is_preferred_contact.description: Indicates whether this contact person is a preferred contact

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

$path.description: The API path for the resource

home_tax.description: Indicates a contact where home country tax rules should be applied

eu_tax_registered.description: Indicates a contact where EC tax rules should be applied

eu_not_tax_registered.description: Indicates an EU contact without a tax number - home tax rules should be applied

rest_of_world_tax.description: Indicates a contact where rest of world tax rules should be applied

is_importer.description: Indicates a contact where import rules should be appliedOnly used for suppliers and FR, ES, IE and UK businesses

registered_cis_name.description: the CIS name for the Contact

subcontractor_verification_number.description: The CIS Verification number for the contact

deduction_rate.description: The CIS Deduction rate for the contact

email_address.description: Indicates whether email address is printed on the invoice

default_delivery_address.description: Indicates which contact address is used for the delivery address of the invoice. Valid options are: INVOICE_ADDRESS, CONTACT_DELIVERY_ADDRESS, NONE.

days_overdue.description: Indicates whether days of overdue are printed in the contact's statement

table_of_balances.description: Indicates whether table of balances is printed in the contact's statement

show_auto_entrepreneur.description: Indicates whether to include auto entrepreneur details on invoices (France only)

show_insurance.description: Indicates whether to include insurance details on invoices (France only)

insurer_id.description: The ID of the Insurer. (France only)

insurance_area.description: The insurance area to be displayed on invoices (France only)

The default delay within which the business' customer has to pay an invoice
Prefer the (customer) contact's attribute 'credit_days' over this setting

customer_credit_terms.description:
The default credit terms options determine how invoice due dates are calculated.
Options include: end of next month, a delay of customer credit_days and immediately.
Only: month_end_invoice, date_from_invoice, immediate_invoice are valid values.
Prefer the (customer) contact's credit terms over this setting

Only: month_end_payment, date_from_payment, immediate_payment are valid values.
Prefer the (vendor) contact's credit terms over this setting
to calculate an invoice's date of payment; only if null, use this as default.
